programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 16 Sooners take the field as an SEC program for the first time as they host the Owls. Brent Venables rebounded from a tough first year at Oklahoma to lead the Sooners to a 10-3 mark in 2023. Temple seeks its first winning campaign since 2019.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Cardinal play their first game as members of the ACC against the Horned Frogs. Stanford competed in the Pac-12 conference and its variations since 1968. Cardinal wide receiver Elic Ayomanor was an ACC preseason first-team selection.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 16 Sooners take the field as an SEC program for the first time as they host the Owls. Brent Venables rebounded from a tough first year at Oklahoma to lead the Sooners to a 10-3 mark in 2023. Temple seeks its first winning campaign since 2019.

programme.desc: The Cardinal play their first game as members of the ACC against the Horned Frogs. Stanford competed in the Pac-12 conference and its variations since 1968. Cardinal wide receiver Elic Ayomanor was an ACC preseason first-team selection.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: Originating from the site of one of the day's best matchups, with a sea of fans cheering wildly in the background, host Rece Davis and analysts Lee Corso, Kirk Herbstreit and Desmond Howard talk college football for three hours, reporting on the top teams, games, players and storylines. David Pollack and Maria Taylor contribute reports, interviews and features. Davis replaced longtime host Chris Fowler in 2015.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Junior quarterback Kyron Drones and the Hokies visit the Commodores. Drones accounted for 22 touchdowns, 17 passing, and 2,903 yards from scrimmage last year. The programs haven't met since 1989. Vanderbilt last enjoyed a winning season in 2013.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 4 Longhorns begin life in the SEC by hosting the Rams. Texas was voted to finish second in the conference to No. 1 Georgia in the preseason media poll. Longhorns junior quarterback Quinn Ewers was an SEC second-team selection.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 5 Crimson Tide begin life without Nick Saban as they host the Hilltoppers. Saban, who won a record seven national titles, with six coming at Alabama, retired after last season and was replaced with Washington head coach Kalen DeBoer.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 21 Wildcats host the Lobos. Brent Brennan debuts on Arizona's sideline after leading San Jose State to a 31-26 record over the last five years. The last meeting between these schools came at the 2015 New Mexico Bowl, which Arizona won 45-37.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.title: Formula 1 Grand Prix Sunday
programme.desc: Featuring pre-race predictions and analysis leading up to today's Formula 1 racing action.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Formula One drivers rev up for the Italian Grand Prix. Max Verstappen won the last two races at Monza, but has just a pair of P2 finishes in the last five events after falling short at his home race in the Netherlands. Lando Norris won the Dutch GP.

programme.title: 2024 US Open Tennis
programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: HBCU teams in North Carolina Central and Alabama State collide in the Orange Blossom Classic. North Carolina Central is 19-5 over the last two seasons. Alabama State running back Marcus Harris II led the team with four rushing touchdowns in 2023.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: NL East adversaries in the Phillies and Braves take the prime-time stage. Atlanta rookie Spencer Schwellenbach (5-6, 3.72 ERA) opposes Aaron Nola (12-6, 3.30). Schwellenbach earned a quality start in a 3-2 decision over Philadelphia on Aug. 22.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: 2024 US Open Tennis
programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: College Football Countdown
programme.desc: A look at the day's college football action, featuring news, highlights and game previews.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 10 Seminoles lick their wounds as they host the Eagles in Week 1. Florida State's visit to Ireland was spoiled by Georgia Tech's buzzer-beating 24-21 victory on Aug. 24. Former Houston Texans coach Bill O'Brien takes over at Boston College.

programme.desc: The Terrapins begin the 2024 campaign by welcoming the Huskies to SECU Stadium. Maryland capped off an 8-5 season in 2023 by knocking off Auburn 31-13 in the Music City Bowl. UConn won the last meeting between the schools in Maryland, 24-21 in 2012.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Cyclones set their 2024 campaign in motion by squaring off against the Fighting Hawks in Week 1. Signal-caller Rocco Becht begins his sophomore season at Iowa State after throwing 23 touchdown passes against eight interceptions in 2023.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Cougars quarterback Donovan Smith faces the Rebels, his hometown team. The Las Vegas native threw for 2,801 yards and 22 TDs, and ran for six scores in 2023. Houston has won all three meetings with UNLV, the last in 2014, by a combined 153-23 line.

programme.title: College Football

programme.desc: Desde Citizens Bank Park en Filadelfia, PA, USA.

programme.title: Aguas arriba
programme.desc: La experiencia de la pesca con mosca en Latinoamérica. La búsqueda de truchas en la Patagonia, sea trout y salmones en Chile, dorados en el norte de Argentina y las magníficas especies como bonefish, pertmit y tarpon de Centroamérica y Caribe.
